Author: jl777c#5810
Content: very good mechanics learn debugging quickly, which is key to coding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or I should say I spend half my time debugging

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so once you can debug, you are halfway there.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if to choose, better to be able to debug well and code not so good, than the other way around

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the reason is the debugging will provide feedback about the code so a good debugger evolves naturally in to a better coder

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and basically it is impossible to code something that is bugfree, though it is possible to code in a way that has significantly less bugs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is by reducing the entropy of the codebase. make it so that if you are doing something in one place and then instead of copy paste, to make a function that does it and use that function in all places. Remove all redundancy from the code. I dont follow this 100% myself, but I should

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes I try to do this, unless I cant figure out how to... There is one change I want to make in staked/komodo that I have been thinking about for a while, its now it chooses `I_AM_NOTARY` and also the ac_private exception.... it uses a static array, but it should use the current array of notary keys instead, otherswise it constantly needs to be changed when we do an era change. I guess this would also help you for komodo elections.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but there must be a way to do it... obviously its not super simple or you would have done it already.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: both use the elected_notaries1[] array, dont they?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but we have 4 and probably will be some silly number after not long as alright wants to change notary keys like every mont or somthing silly.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have made functions to return the arrays via timestamp pf blocks

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but block time stamp isnt always avalible in the code

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: like the I AM NOTARY is set at start, befor eany blocks are loaded... I guess in this case it could use local time, and then call an update somehwere possibley... pac-private exception, possibly can be done with the funtions I already have, but as we are not going to use those chains I havent worried about it and juts hard coded it to notaris_staked[] for the tests we needed to do there/.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it is a new testchain, you can just overwrite the elected notaries arrrays, only if you want to be able to validate the chain using different notaries at different blocks do you need all.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: at some point we will need hashtables of all the pubkeys and their active era

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: youve mentioned those before, before I go making it more complicated aI guess I should do some readin up on those

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: its almost like magic. and so simple to. arbitrary number of entries, constant time to search for things
